subject: Re: Junit testing of web services
msgSnippet: Thanks for your response. But you could have safely assumed that anyone asking for use of Junit for web services would necessarily have common sense of using
messageBody:
Thanks for your response. But you could have safely assumed that
anyone asking for use of Junit for web services would necessarily
have common sense of using any of the major search engines. Instead
of sermons on helping me exercise search engine skills, some
concrete info would have been more useful (for example, look at
other responses on this topic).

vk. --- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Simon Chappell"
<simonpeterchappell@...> wrote:
>
> On 9/1/06, vkv3056 <vkv3056@...> wrote:
> > Hi,
> > Please provide some info on Junit testing of web services. I am
sure
> > someone has done it.
> > Cheers.
> > vk.
>
> Generally, a few minutes using one of the major search engines will
> return plenty of suitable candidate packages.
>
> I just spent ten seconds typing "junit testing web services" into
> Google and received a link for wsunit on the first page of results.
> Perhaps this might be of interest?
>
> I'm not providing the link, out of a desire to help you exercise
your
> search engine skills. If you're going to get very far in this
highly
> connected world, some good "search foo" will serve you well.
>
> Simon
>
> --
> www.simonpeter.org
>
